thread.title: Oct. 16 TV Picks: ‘Show Boat’ on ‘Live From Lincoln Center’
thread.title_full: Oct. 16 TV Picks: ‘Show Boat’ on ‘Live From Lincoln Center’ | The Seattle Times

author: Doug Knoop
title: Oct. 16 TV Picks: ‘Show Boat’ on ‘Live From Lincoln Center’
text:
‘Show Boat’ PBS’ “Live from Lincoln Center” series offers this concert version of the great Jerome Kern and Oscar Hammerstein II musical, featuring The New York Philharmonic, Vanessa Williams, Julian Ovenden, Fred Willard, Norm Lewis, Jane Alexander and Lauren Worsham. 9 p.m. Friday, Oct. 16, on KCTS.

Doug Knoop: dknoop@seattletimes.com or on Twitter @dougknoop 

Also on Friday   “The Bad Seed” (1956), 6:45 p.m. (TCM): Odd fatal accidents lead a woman to realize that her 8-year-old daughter was born to kill.
“High School Football,” 7 p.m. (ROOT): O’Dea at Eastside Catholic (Live).
“The Amazing Race,” 8 p.m. (CBS): Racers soar above the breathtaking Victoria Falls before encountering a double U-turn; Team Texas tries to eliminate The Green Team.
“Reign,” 8 p.m. (The CW): When Catherine returns to France, she is imprisoned; Mary makes tough decisions about securing Scotland’s future; Lola feels conflicted.
“Truth Be Told,” 8:30 p.m. (NBC): Tracy and Mitch scramble to find a baby-sitter when Angie’s ex-boyfriend gives her four tickets to a Jay-Z concert.
“Satisfaction,” 10 p.m. (USA): Neil and Grace face their infidelities of the past six months; Adriana plots to keep Neil and Grace apart.
The New York Times
